summary: This is an email chain from July 16, 2020, between a U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) employee and an FBI recipient, forwarding an unsolicited email from a civilian named Jose Leon. The forwarded email contains bizarre claims about EMP technology, extremists, and trafficking in Wisconsin, and links them to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The government employees dismiss the sender as 'a little off' and discuss their protocol for handling unverified information.

persons.name: Jose Leon
persons.context: A civilian who sent an unsolicited email to the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) making unverified and bizarre claims about EMP technology, extremists, trafficking in Wisconsin, and linking them to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His name is invoked by the civilian email sender (Jose Leon) in the subject line and body of a forwarded email making unverified claims about trafficking and extremists.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her name is invoked by the civilian email sender (Jose Leon) in the subject line and body of a forwarded email making unverified claims about trafficking and extremists. Note: The name is misspelled as 'Ghalian Maxwell' in the original text.

events.title: Forwarding of Unverified Civilian Email
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) employee forwards an email from Jose Leon to an FBI contact. The email contains wild claims linking EMP technology, extremists, and trafficking in Wisconsin to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI receiving and processing unsolicited, unverified tips from the public regarding the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The forwarded email from Jose Leon contains fantastical and unsubstantiated claims about EMP technology hiding extremists and traffickers in Wisconsin.
Government personnel internally assess the tipster as 'a little off' and follow a standard protocol to forward such unverified civilian information to designated FBI contacts.
